place.name: TODENHAM
place.gazetteerText: TODDENHAM, a parish, with a village, in the district of Shipston-on-Stour and county of Gloucester; 3¼ miles NE of Moreton r. station. Post town, Moreton-in-the-Marsh. Acres, 2,477. Real property, £3,616. Pop., 408. Houses, 90. The manor, with T. House, belongs to Sir P. Pole, Bart. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Gloucester and Bristol. Value, £470.* Patron, the Bishop of G. and B. The church is good, and has a tower and spire. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
